chunks.en: Am I being petty?
On the fifth day of the new year, my cousin arranged a blind date on short notice.
We contacted each other on the sixth day and had a good chat.
On the seventh day, we had a brief half-hour chat.

On the eighth day, work started. To find a topic, I lied and said the company gave out a 200 yuan back-to-work bonus (actually only 100), and I gave her 100 (she opened her store on the eighth), saying it was to treat her to bubble tea.
She didn't reply, and when I asked again that evening, there was still no response.

On the ninth day, the red envelope was returned. My cousin asked me how it was going. I explained the situation to him and suspected that she thought the red envelope was too small (she mentioned on the sixth day that she liked generous and honest people). My cousin also thought 100 was too little, at least 300.
My cousin went to the intermediary to test the waters. The intermediary later replied that she said they hadn't chatted much because they hadn't met and there were few topics.
On the evening of the ninth, after 9 PM, she replied saying she was too busy on the eighth, but I still felt that even if she was busy, she shouldn't have not replied.

She opened a clothing store in her hometown, which also started business on the 8th. Because I remembered that she said she liked generous people, I initially thought about whether to buy her a flower basket, but then I thought that her store was not opening for the first time, and buying a flower basket was not appropriate.
So I said I would give her 100 yuan to treat her to bubble tea, the purpose was to find some topics to chat about. I don't know what everyone thinks about this.
Don't start self-reflecting before it even begins, next one.

Money is for women to see, not for women to spend. Relying on money to find topics is the wrong approach.
Bro, I'm not trying to criticize you.
Giving a red envelope right away is not appropriate, you might as well just order her a cup of bubble tea.
What's the idea behind splitting a 200 yuan back-to-work bonus in half with her?
Why would she want to split this money with you?

chunks.en: From another perspective, if a woman had a blind date with you, chatted with you for two days, and then on the third day told you that the company had given out a red envelope and split 100 with you, what would you think?
The only phrase that comes to mind is 'a hungry wolf pouncing on its prey'.

All women in the world like men who brag on the surface; you may not have money, but you have to make her feel that you are very interesting; let her see that you are very rich, where you play and check in, and what high-end places you go to; women will only fall in love with 'rich people' who are stingy with them; as long as you can get past your own bottom line, women are easy to deceive.
Since ancient times, sincerity has always been betrayed.
Elon Musk manages a company with a market value of hundreds of billions, and doesn't forget to reply to comments on Twitter. You're telling me she's too busy to reply to you?
Cut it out, bro.

Why don't you and I chat for a few days, I'm definitely better than her, you can just 'v' me 50.
Who gives money directly right away ğŸ˜“ That's too presumptuous, right?
Red envelopes and gifts can only play a lubricating role in certain situations and cannot touch the true emotional needs deep within.
'Treating her to bubble tea' is essentially using material things to create connections and topics.

In a blind date situation, both parties are testing each other and do not fully understand each other. If one party relies too much on material things to promote the relationship, it may be interpreted by the other party as 'impatient' or 'being eager for quick success'.
It is recommended to start from her life, hobbies, work, and emotional experiences to find resonance.
For example, her opening a clothing store could be a topic entry point.

You can ask her about her feelings about opening the store, the challenges she has encountered, and even her plans for the future of the store. This will not only make her feel your concern for her, but also encourage more natural and in-depth conversations.
I thought of some topics for reference only: 1.
Opening a store must be very busy, is there anything I can help you with lately?
If there is, feel free to askå“¦ï½ (Demonstrates your concern for her life and support for her career) 2.
Which piece of clothing in your store do you like the most?
Why? (Understanding the other person's preferences and taste) 3.
Since opening the store, have you had any 'hit' clothing items?
Are there any customer reviews that made you particularly happy? (Let her share the sense of accomplishment of doing business and the interesting interactions with customers) 4.

What color or style of clothing do you think best represents your current mood? (Combining emotions with clothing style, clothing is also a way of expressing oneself) Establishing emotional connections through daily details is far more effective than deepening the impression with a red envelope.
It's rare to see an ATM think, but sadly it's thinking that the money it spat out wasn't enough, hard to resist laughing.
@M48A1 Is that the disgusting, nauseating, greasy style?

First of all, she's not interested. If she were interested, she'd think 'that's just your personality, I can be compatible'. If she's not interested, she'll think 'that's just your situation, I'll reject you directly'.

So, you still have to meet on a blind date, and if you feel attracted, take the initiative. Get to first base (holding hands) on the first date, and quickly move towards second base, third base, and a home run. Once A goes in, she will feel like you owe her, and the relationship will be solid.
It's really better not to give the 100 yuan. Giving it actually lets the other person figure out your bottom line.
You don't have any problems, and you're not petty, just move on to the next one.
Don't just give people money whenever you feel like it, okay?
Giving money or gifts should have a valid reason. Why should people accept your money if you just give it to them right away?
